hh.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.

hh.how_to_earn: Unlocked at Level 1.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Level 28.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Houndmaster⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Level 23.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Timber Wolf⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Your Beasts have Charge.

hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Level 43.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Tundra Rhino⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Lightwarden⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.

hh.flavor_text: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨The Black Knight⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.

hh.flavor_text: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Young Priestess⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.

hh.flavor_text: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Big Game Hunter⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text:
At the start of your turn,
swap this minion with a
   random one in your hand.
hh.name: Alarm-o-Bot
hh.flavor_text: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.

hh.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.

hh.flavor_text: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Acolyte of Pain⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Divine Shield
hh.name: Argent Squire
hh.flavor_text: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Argent Squire⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Enrage: +5 Attack.
hh.name: Angry Chicken
hh.flavor_text: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Angry Chicken⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Stealth
hh.name: Worgen Infiltrator
hh.flavor_text: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Worgen Infiltrator⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health.
hh.name: Voodoo Doctor
hh.flavor_text: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 55.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Voodoo Doctor⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Spell Damage +1. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
hh.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
hh.flavor_text: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Bloodmage Thalnos⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.
hh.name: King Mukla
hh.flavor_text: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨King Mukla⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.

hh.flavor_text: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Druid Level 59.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Novice Engineer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.

hh.flavor_text: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Sylvanas Windrunner⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Hall of Fame⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Stealth
hh.name: Jungle Panther
hh.flavor_text: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Jungle Panther⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.
hh.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
hh.flavor_text: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Priest Level 53.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Shattered Sun Cleric⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Divine Shield
hh.name: Scarlet Crusader
hh.flavor_text: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Scarlet Crusader⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Windfury
hh.name: Thrallmar Farseer
hh.flavor_text: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Thrallmar Farseer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Divine Shield
hh.name: Silvermoon Guardian
hh.flavor_text: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Silvermoon Guardian⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Mechanical Dragonling.
hh.name: Dragonling Mechanic
hh.flavor_text: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Mage Level 53.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Dragonling Mechanic⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Stealth
hh.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
hh.flavor_text: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Stranglethorn Tiger⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
hh.name: Leper Gnome
hh.flavor_text: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Leper Gnome⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Taunt Divine Shield
hh.name: Sunwalker
hh.flavor_text: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Sunwalker⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Windfury
hh.name: Windfury Harpy
hh.flavor_text: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Windfury Harpy⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
hh.name: Twilight Drake
hh.flavor_text: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Twilight Drake⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
hh.name: Questing Adventurer
hh.flavor_text: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Questing Adventurer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Can't attack.
hh.name: Ancient Watcher
hh.flavor_text: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ancient Watcher⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
hh.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
hh.flavor_text: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Dark Iron Dwarf⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.
hh.name: Spellbreaker
hh.flavor_text: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Spellbreaker⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
hh.name: Youthful Brewmaster
hh.flavor_text: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Youthful Brewmaster⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Each player draws 2 cards.
hh.name: Coldlight Oracle
hh.flavor_text: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Coldlight Oracle⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
hh.name: Mana Addict
hh.flavor_text: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Mana Addict⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
hh.name: Ancient Brewmaster
hh.flavor_text: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ancient Brewmaster⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
hh.name: Sunfury Protector
hh.flavor_text: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Sunfury Protector⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
hh.name: Crazed Alchemist
hh.flavor_text: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Crazed Alchemist⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
hh.name: Old Murk-Eye
hh.flavor_text: He's a legend among murlocs.  "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.
hh.how_to_earn: Unlocked when you have all the Murlocs from the Classic Set.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Murlocs from the Expert and Basic Sets.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Old Murk-Eye⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Hall of Fame⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.
hh.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
hh.flavor_text: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 57.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Acidic Swamp Ooze⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Charge Divine Shield
hh.name: Argent Commander
hh.flavor_text: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Argent Commander⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
hh.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
hh.flavor_text: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Pint-Sized Summoner⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
hh.name: Secretkeeper
hh.flavor_text: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Secretkeeper⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
hh.name: Mad Bomber
hh.flavor_text: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Mad Bomber⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.
hh.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
hh.flavor_text: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Tinkmaster Overspark⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Your Charge minions have +1 Attack.
hh.name: Warsong Commander
hh.flavor_text: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.
hh.how_to_earn: Unlocked at Level 1.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Level 36.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Warsong Commander⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
hh.name: Mind Control Tech
hh.flavor_text: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Mind Control Tech⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
hh.name: Arcane Golem
hh.flavor_text: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Arcane Golem⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
hh.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
hh.flavor_text: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Cabal Shadow Priest⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
hh.name: Defender of Argus
hh.flavor_text: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Defender of Argus⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
hh.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
hh.flavor_text: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Gadgetzan Auctioneer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
hh.name: Loot Hoarder
hh.flavor_text: Always roll need.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Loot Hoarder⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.
hh.name: Abomination
hh.flavor_text: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Abomination⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
hh.name: Lorewalker Cho
hh.flavor_text: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Lorewalker Cho⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
hh.name: Demolisher
hh.flavor_text: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Demolisher⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give your other Murlocs +2 Health.
hh.name: Coldlight Seer
hh.flavor_text: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Coldlight Seer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
hh.name: Mountain Giant
hh.flavor_text: His mother said that he was just big boned.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Mountain Giant⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
hh.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
hh.flavor_text: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Cairne Bloodhoof⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Summon an AWESOME invention.
hh.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
hh.flavor_text: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: This was rewarded to players who helped test the Store during the Beta.

hh.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.

hh.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨SI:7 Agent⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.
hh.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
hh.flavor_text: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Dire Wolf Alpha⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Choose One - Transform into a 4/4 with Charge or a 4/6 with Taunt.
hh.name: Druid of the Claw
hh.flavor_text: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Druid of the Claw⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage or Silence a minion.
hh.name: Keeper of the Grove
hh.flavor_text: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Keeper of the Grove⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Poisonous
hh.name: Emperor Cobra
hh.flavor_text: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Emperor Cobra⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Choose One - +5 Attack or +5 Health and Taunt.

hh.flavor_text: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ancient of War⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)
hh.name: Dust Devil

hh.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.

hh.text: Taunt Overload: (3)
hh.name: Earth Elemental

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Earth Elemental⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.

hh.flavor_text: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Unbound Elemental⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.

hh.flavor_text: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

hh.text: Battlecry: Freeze a character.

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Frost Elemental⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.

hh.text: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ragnaros the Firelord⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Hall of Fame⁩ expansion.

hh.flavor_text: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

hh.text: Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.

hh.flavor_text: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.

hh.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card.

hh.how_to_earn: Unlocked at Level 1.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Level 40.

hh.text: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.

hh.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Lightspawn⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.

hh.text: Taunt Enrage: +3 Attack.

hh.text: Enrage: +3 Attack
hh.name: Amani Berserker

hh.text: Taunt

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Mogu'shan Warden⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.

hh.flavor_text: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Arathi Weaponsmith⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

hh.flavor_text: No Pain, No Gain.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Warlock Level 57.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Gurubashi Berserker⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.

hh.flavor_text: She accepts guild funds for repairs!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Armorsmith⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Taunt
hh.name: Shieldbearer
hh.flavor_text: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Shieldbearer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Enrage: Windfury and +1 Attack.
hh.name: Raging Worgen
hh.flavor_text: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Raging Worgen⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Charge Enrage: +6 Attack

hh.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Murloc Scout.

hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Rogue Level 53.

hh.text: Your other Murlocs have +2 Attack.

hh.flavor_text: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Murloc Warleader⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Your other Murlocs have +1 Attack.

hh.flavor_text: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Warlock Level 53.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Grimscale Oracle⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.

hh.flavor_text: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Murloc Tidecaller⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Stealth Poisonous
hh.name: Patient Assassin
hh.flavor_text: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Patient Assassin⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.

hh.flavor_text: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.

hh.flavor_text: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

hh.text: Charge
hh.name: King Krush
hh.flavor_text: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨King Krush⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.

hh.flavor_text: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Harvest Golem⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.

hh.flavor_text: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Nat Pagle⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
hh.name: Harrison Jones
hh.flavor_text: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Harrison Jones⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.

hh.flavor_text: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Archmage Antonidas⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.

hh.flavor_text: Time to write some flavor text.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Nozdormu⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.

hh.flavor_text: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Alexstrasza⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.

hh.flavor_text: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

hh.text: Spell Damage +5
hh.name: Malygos

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Malygos⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.

hh.flavor_text: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Faceless Manipulator⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Classic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Adjacent minions have +2 Attack.

hh.flavor_text: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.
hh.how_to_earn: Unlocked at Level 4.
hh.how_to_earn_golden: Unlocked at Level 43.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Flametongue Totem⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Basic⁩ expansion.

hh.text: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.

hh.flavor_text: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

hh.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.
hh.name: King of Beasts
hh.flavor_text: He never sleeps.  Not even in the mighty jungle.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨King of Beasts⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give your other Mechs +2 Attack.
hh.name: Metaltooth Leaper
hh.flavor_text: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Metaltooth Leaper⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
hh.name: Gahz'rilla
hh.flavor_text: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Gahz'rilla⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Enrage: +1 Attack.
hh.name: Warbot
hh.flavor_text: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Warbot⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Gain 5 Armor.
hh.name: Shieldmaiden
hh.flavor_text: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Shieldmaiden⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +2/+2.
hh.name: Screwjank Clunker
hh.flavor_text: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Screwjank Clunker⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
hh.name: Iron Juggernaut
hh.flavor_text: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Iron Juggernaut⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Divine Shield
hh.name: Shielded Minibot
hh.flavor_text: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Shielded Minibot⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2.
hh.name: Quartermaster
hh.flavor_text: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Quartermaster⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.
hh.name: Cobalt Guardian
hh.flavor_text: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Cobalt Guardian⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
hh.name: Bolvar Fordragon
hh.flavor_text: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Bolvar Fordragon⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.name: Puddlestomper
hh.flavor_text: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Puddlestomper⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
hh.name: Ogre Brute
hh.flavor_text: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ogre Brute⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Windfury, Overload: (1) 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
hh.name: Dunemaul Shaman
hh.flavor_text: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Dunemaul Shaman⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
hh.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
hh.flavor_text: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Stonesplinter Trogg⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
hh.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
hh.flavor_text: He's burly because he does CrossFit.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Burly Rockjaw Trogg⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Restore 8 Health to your hero.
hh.name: Antique Healbot
hh.flavor_text: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Antique Healbot⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.name: Salty Dog
hh.flavor_text: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Salty Dog⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.name: Lost Tallstrider
hh.flavor_text: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Lost Tallstrider⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
hh.name: Shadowboxer
hh.flavor_text: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Shadowboxer⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.
hh.name: Kezan Mystic
hh.flavor_text: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Kezan Mystic⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
hh.name: Ship's Cannon
hh.flavor_text: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ship's Cannon⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to all minions.
hh.name: Explosive Sheep
hh.flavor_text: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Explosive Sheep⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
hh.name: Anima Golem
hh.flavor_text: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Anima Golem⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Give each player a Spare Part.
hh.name: Mechanical Yeti
hh.flavor_text: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

hh.name: Druid of the Fang

hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Clockwork Gnome⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +4 Health.
hh.name: Upgraded Repair Bot
hh.flavor_text: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Upgraded Repair Bot⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Windfury
hh.name: Flying Machine
hh.flavor_text: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Flying Machine⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.name: Annoy-o-Tron
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Annoy-o-Tron⁩ is a ⁨Hero⁩ from the ⁨GLOBAL_CARD_SET_TB⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.
hh.name: Siege Engine
hh.flavor_text: Wintergrasp Keep's only weakness!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Siege Engine⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.
hh.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
hh.flavor_text: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Steamwheedle Sniper⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
hh.name: Ogre Ninja
hh.flavor_text: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Ogre Ninja⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
hh.name: Illuminator
hh.flavor_text: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Illuminator⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.
hh.name: Madder Bomber
hh.flavor_text: Dang, Bomber, calm down.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Madder Bomber⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
hh.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
hh.flavor_text: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Arcane Nullifier X-21⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
hh.name: Gnomish Experimenter
hh.flavor_text: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Gnomish Experimenter⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Taunt
hh.name: Target Dummy
hh.flavor_text: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Target Dummy⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.
hh.name: Jeeves
hh.flavor_text: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Jeeves⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
hh.name: Goblin Sapper
hh.flavor_text: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Goblin Sapper⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 2-Cost minion.
hh.name: Piloted Shredder
hh.flavor_text: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Piloted Shredder⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Taunt Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each enemy Deathrattle minion.
hh.name: Lil' Exorcist
hh.flavor_text: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Lil' Exorcist⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Charge Taunt
hh.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
hh.flavor_text: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Gnomeregan Infantry⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
hh.name: Bomb Lobber
hh.flavor_text: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Bomb Lobber⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
hh.name: Floating Watcher
hh.flavor_text: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Floating Watcher⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
hh.name: Scarlet Purifier
hh.flavor_text: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.
hh.description: Hearthstone's ⁨Scarlet Purifier⁩ is a ⁨Minion⁩ from the ⁨Goblins vs Gnomes⁩ expansion.

hh.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
hh.name: Tinkertown Technician
hh.flavor_text: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

hh.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Dragon to your hand.
hh.name: Bone Drake
hh.flavor_text: The bone drake brings all the dragons to the yard. He would teach you, but you have no cards.
hh.guide:
Bone Drake is a Rare Neutral card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a six-mana 6/5 Dragon minion with a Deathrattle to add a random Dragon to your hand.

A random Dragon can be Neutral or from any class, and the probability to get any Dragon minion is the same. You can even get Dragons from other classes from Bone Drake.

Because Dragons in Standard are quite powerful right now, Bone Drake is likely to find a fairly big minion for you in that format. There are a lot more midrange Dragons in Wild, so the results there are not as end-game-oriented. Both options have their upsides and downsides: sometimes you’d just need a minion you can play fast, whereas in other games you are looking for the biggest threat you can find.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

N'Zoth, the Corruptor can resummon Bone Drake for a decent body and even more Dragons.

Standard Format

Bone Drake is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

There are 17 Dragons in Standard format:

  • Deathwing
  • Deathwing, Dragonlord
  • Alexstrasza
  • Malygos
  • Nozdormu
  • Onyxia
  • Ysera
  • Primordial Drake
  • Sindragosa
  • Bone Drake
  • Book Wyrm
  • Scaled Nightmare
  • Cobalt Scalebane
  • Drakonid Operative
  • Midnight Drake
  • Twilight Drake
  • Faerie Dragon

Nine of the 17 cost eight mana or more, so you can expect to get a big dragon from Bone Drake’s Deathrattle more than half of the time. You can even get a Drakonid Operative even if you are not a Priest!

Wild Format

In addition to the Dragons available in Standard format, there are the following Dragons in Wild format:

  • Nefarian
  • Chromaggus
  • Chillmaw
  • Coldarra Drake
  • Drakonid Crusher
  • Volcanic Drake
  • Azure Drake
  • Dragon Consort
  • Dragonkin Sorcerer
  • Hungry Dragon
  • Twilight Guardian
  • Twilight Whelp

Overall, there are 29 Dragons in Wild format. 11 of the 29 Dragons cost eight mana or more – there are a lot more midrange Dragons in Wild format than in Standard, so the probability to get an end-game threat is much lower.

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide where we share all of the information available and put the cards in a visual guide format.

Make sure to follow us on the social media methods provided above for the fastest updates on all of the latest Frozen Throne cards.

hh.text: After you play a Secret, put a random Hunter Secret into the battlefield.
hh.name: Professor Putricide
hh.flavor_text: Among his more notable inventions: A tentacle-groomer, a plague that would wipe out all life on Azeroth, and a fidget spinner.
hh.guide:
Professor Putricide is a Legendary Hunter class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a four-mana 5/4 minion with a special effect that after you play a Secret, Professor Putricide puts a random Hunter Secret into the battlefield.

The wording on Professor Putricide is reminiscent of Mysterious Challenger, a Paladin class card that created an entire archetype, Secret Paladin. However, there are significant differences between the two:

  • Mysterious Challenger is able to put several Secrets into play all by itself
  • Mysterious Challenger thins your deck by putting Secrets into play from your deck, thus making your following draws better – and takes you to fatigue faster, but these types of decks generally do not play until fatigue anyway

Therefore, the swings provided by Professor Putricide require more resources and are less powerful than those created by Mysterious Challenger. Then again, Mysterious Challenger was the dominant card of its era, so this does not mean that Professor Putricide cannot be strong.

Professor Putricide’s effect triggers in the After Play phase. This means that the Secret has to be successfully played in order for Professor Putricide to put another Secret into play. If something interrupts the spell, Professor Putricide will do nothing.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Professor Putricide’s Secrets do not count as spells that you cast and therefore will not buff Secretkeeper and will not increase the spell count for Yogg-Saron, Hope's End.

If a Secret is prevented by Counterspell, Professor Putricide will not put another Secret into play either.

Cloaked Huntress allows Hunter to play Secrets for free and can thus be extremely rewarding with Professor Putricide. Playing Cloaked Huntress on Turn three into Professor Putricide and a number of Secrets on Turn four is powerful, but risky, as the plan crumbles if Cloaked Huntress is killed immediately. They can both be played together only on Turn seven, which is a lot later in the game.

Eaglehorn Bow benefits from any Secrets. It can benefit even more from completely random Secrets from Professor Putricide, as they are more difficult for the opponent to play around.

Standard Format

Professor Putricide is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

These are the current Hunter Secrets in Standard:

  • Cat Trick

  • Explosive Trap

  • Freezing Trap

  • Hidden Cache

  • Misdirection

  • Snake Trap

  • Snipe

  • Venomstrike Trap

It is important to note that only one of each type of Secret can be in play at the same time. Therefore, if you want to use Professor Putricide with multiple Secrets, you will sometimes be unable to play them all, as Professor manages to put one in play before you do. For two Secrets, the probability of this happening in Standard is 1/7, and for three Secrets it is 43%. Building a full Christmas tree is by no means guaranteed even if you have the cards and mana!

In order to play around random Secrets, here are the ways to trigger all Hunter Secrets in Standard format:

  • Cast a spell (Cat Trick)

  • Attack the enemy Hero with a weapon (Explosive Trap, Misdirection)

  • Attack the enemy Hero with a minion (Explosive Trap, Freezing Trap, Misdirection)

  • Attack an enemy minion with a weapon (Snake Trap, Venomstrike Trap)

  • Attack an enemy minion with a minion (Freezing Trap, Snake Trap, Venomstrike Trap)

  • Play a minion (Hidden Cache, Snipe)

Note that Secrets trigger in order they were played, and the ones that go off first can prevent other Secrets with similar conditions from triggering.

Wild Format

In addition to the Secrets available to Hunter in Standard, there are also the following Hunter Secrets in Wild:

  • Bear Trap

  • Dart Trap

Therefore, if you want to play two Secrets, the probability that Professor Putricide puts the second Secret into play before you do in Wild is 1/9. For three Secrets, Professor Putricide puts one in play before you do 33% of the time.

In order to play around random Secrets, here are the ways to trigger all Hunter Secrets in Wild format:

  • Cast a spell (Cat Trick)

  • Attack the enemy Hero with a weapon (Explosive Trap, Misdirection, Bear Trap)

  • Attack the enemy Hero with a minion (Explosive Trap, Freezing Trap, Misdirection, Bear Trap)

  • Attack an enemy minion with a weapon (Snake Trap, Venomstrike Trap)

  • Attack an enemy minion with a minion (Freezing Trap, Snake Trap, Venomstrike Trap)

  • Play a minion (Hidden Cache, Snipe)

  • Use your Hero Power (Dart Trap)

 

Note that Secrets trigger in order they were played, and the ones that go off first can prevent other Secrets with similar conditions from triggering.

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide.

hh.text: Battlecry: Shuffle a copy of your opponent's deck into your deck.
hh.name: Archbishop Benedictus
hh.flavor_text: Nobody expects the Archbishop's Benediction!
hh.guide:
Archbishop Benedictus is a Legendary Priest class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a seven-mana 4/6 minion with a Battlecry to shuffle a copy of your opponent’s deck into your deck.

While the Archbishop can ensure that Priest will not readily run out of cards, copying the opponent’s deck has its downsides:

  • The opponent’s cards are mixed in the deck with your own cards, which makes your draws extremely inconsistent. This is very, very bad in a card game.
  • Depending on the strategy of the opponent’s deck, if the opponent has already drawn some of their key cards, you may be left with a weaker win condition than the opponent – or even no win condition at all in case of a combo deck, if you only get some of the combo pieces.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

While Archbishop Benedictus seems like a sure way to not lose in fatigue, this may not always be the case:

  • Copying the deck of a Jade Druid requires there to be at least one Jade Idol in the deck in order to avoid fatigue – and even in that case, going for a long game will most likely fail as Jade Druid gets Jade cards on more consistent basis.
  • Warrior can cycle infinite cards into their deck with two copies of Dead Man's Hand. If you copy a deck and do not get both copies, the Warrior can shuffle more cards into their deck than you have.

With Brann Bronzebeard (in Wild), you can shuffle two copies of your opponent’s deck into your deck!

Standard Format

Archbishop Benedictus is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide.

hh.text: Whenever another minion is Frozen, add a copy of it to your hand.
hh.name: Moorabi
hh.flavor_text: Most disturbing is how Moorabi covers all those frozen minions with flavored syrup.
hh.guide:
Moorabi is a Legendary Shaman class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a six-mana 4/4 minion with a special effect that whenever another minion is Frozen, Moorabi adds a copy of it to your hand.

Moorabi can be used to copy both friendly minions and the opponent’s minions, but it cannot copy itself.

Moorabi’s effect will not activate from minions that are already frozen when Moorabi is played. However, it is possible to freeze a minion multiple times even if it is already frozen to get additional copies of it, so you can have a frozen minion on the board, play Moorabi, and then use another freeze effect on that frozen minion to get a copy of it.

Freezing a minion generally causes it to lose one chance to attack. Typically, this means losing an entire turn, but if you freeze your own minion that could attack but does not – either a minion with Charge or a minion played on an earlier turn – it will unfreeze already at the end of your turn. This can be useful in multiple ways, for example not leaving your own minion frozen for the opponent’s turn, in case the opponent has any freeze synergy cards.

It is difficult for Shaman to gain multiple cards from Moorabi’s effect. Shaman has only one card that freezes multiple minions at once, Hyldnir Frostrider, which freezes your own minions. Furthermore, Shaman has only two other cards with repeatable freeze effects, Voodoo Hexxer (freezes anything it damages) and Frozen Crusher (freezes itself when attacking, so in practice every other turn). This lack of freeze support limits the usefulness of Moorabi.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

There are several freeze effects available for Shaman to activate Moorabi’s effect:

  • Glacial Shard (can freeze one enemy minion)
  • Frost Shock (can freeze one enemy minion)
  • Brrrloc (can freeze one enemy minion)
  • Cryostasis (buffs and freezes one minion)
  • Hyldnir Frostrider (freezes all your other minions)
  • Avalanche (freezes one minion, deals damage to adjacent ones – downside if freezing your own)
  • Voodoo Hexxer (freezes any minion it damages)
  • Frost Elemental (can freeze one minion)
  • Frozen Crusher (freezes itself)

All of these cards are available in both Standard and Wild formats.

If you are playing against Mage, you can attack your own minions into a Water Elemental or Snowchugger (Wild) in order to freeze your minions. In a Shaman mirror match, you can attack into a Voodoo Hexxer. Those are the only cards from your opponent that you can proactively take advantage of to freeze your minions.

Ice Breaker can be used to destroy frozen minions. It has synergy with Moorabi: you can first add a copy of a minion to your hand by freezing it, and then destroy the original with Ice Breaker.

Standard Format

Moorabi is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

 

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide.

hh.text: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon a random Legendary minion.
hh.name: Rotface
hh.flavor_text: Daddy! I think I made a Legendary!
hh.guide:
Rotface is a Legendary Warrior class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is an eight-mana 4/6 minion with a special effect that whenever it survives damage, it summons a random Legendary minion.

There are both advantages and disadvantages to summoning the random minions: summoning them directly on the board is a huge tempo boost – around 5/5 stats on average per minion summoned – but on the other hand almost half of the Legendary minions in the game have a Battlecry effect, which you cannot use when the minion is summoned directly on the board.

With 4/6 stats for eight mana, Rotface is one of the weakest minions for its mana cost. You have to get at least one activation of its effect, preferably more, to make it worth playing. Because Rotface’s effect is only activated when it survives damage, you generally need to activate it on the turn it is played, as the opponent may be able to kill it in one hit – even a simple Fireball will do – and then its effect will not activate.

On the other hand, if the opponent is not able to deal enough damage with a single hit, Rotface threatens to summon powerful minions on the board.

Luckily, Warrior has multiple means to activate Rotface’s effect, even for zero mana. Having a Blood Razor or Death's Bite (Wild) in hand when playing it can give one activation, as can an Animated Berserker on the board. Add in two copies of Inner Rage, and Warrior can potentially activate Rotface four times without spending any mana. Such a spree would require a lot of setup, but less extensive setups are completely possible for a Warrior deck built to take advantage of damage effects.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Rotface has good synergy with the Hero Power of Scourgelord Garrosh: at ten mana, you can play Rotface and use the Hero Power to activate it immediately on the same turn.

Rotface synergizes well with the area-of-effect and chip damage effects available to Warrior, such as:

  • Inner Rage
  • Animated Berserker
  • Blood To Ichor
  • Cruel Taskmaster
  • Slam
  • Ravaging Ghoul
  • Blood Razor
  • Whirlwind
  • Revenge (Wild)
  • Death's Bite (Wild)
  • Bouncing Blade (Wild)

Standard Format

Rotface is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

How good is a random Legendary minion? Here are some statistics for Standard format:

  • 105 Legendary minions
  • Median cost is six, average cost is 5.98
  • Median attack is five, average attack is 4.76
  • Median health is five, average health is 5.51
  • 11 Taunt minions
  • 45 Battlecry minions
  • 14 Deathrattle minions
  • 5 Charge minions
  • 4 Divine Shield minions

Wild Format

How good is a random Legendary minion? Here are some statistics for Wild format:

  • 166 Legendary minions
  • Median cost is six, average cost is 6.09
  • Median attack is five, average attack is 4.95
  • Median health is five, average health is 5.61
  • 12 Taunt minions
  • 66 Battlecry minions
  • 25 Deathrattle minions
  • 8 Charge minions
  • 4 Divine Shield minions

 

Knights of the Frozen Throne

hh.text: Battlecry: Discover a copy of a minion in your deck.
hh.name: Stitched Tracker
hh.flavor_text: He's just exercising his right to bear arms.
hh.guide:
Stitched Tracker is a Common Hunter class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a three-mana 2/2 minion with a Battlecry to Discover a copy of a minion in your deck.

With Hunter often focused on Beast synergies, it is notable that Stitched Tracker is not a Beast and cannot be used to activate those synergies.

As a three-mana 2/2, Stitched Tracker is a significant tempo loss when played, unable to compete with other minions of similar mana cost. Hunter also has tons of three-cost cards available, so competition for the deck slot is fierce.

Stitched Tracker Discovers a copy of a minion, and therefore generates additional resources as the original minion remains in the deck. The flexibility of the Discover effect also allows you to pick a minion that is good for your current matchup and situation.

Stitched Tracker can find specific minions in combo decks and decks with a small number of minions extremely reliably. For example, a Yogg’n’Load style Hunter deck could play multiple Yogg-Saron, Hope's Ends with Stitched Trackers.

If there are up to three minions in the deck, Stitched Tracker will always offer each of them. With four minions, the probability to be offered a specific minion is 75%, and with five minions it is 60%.

87%

63%

6

1

4

80%

55%

 

As can be seen from the table, because Discover offers you three options, the probability to find a specific minion increases rapidly as the number of minions left in the deck decreases. The probability to find a minion you have two copies left is also a fair bit better than the probability to find a minion with just one copy left.

For a minion-based deck, in the mid-game you can expect to Discover a minion with two copies left in the deck roughly half of the time. In the early game, the odds are somewhat lower than that. Picking up that single copy of N'Zoth, the Corruptor is not very easy though.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Stitched Tracker can Discover a copy of itself, if there is still another one left in the deck. This can be used to create multiple three-mana 2/2 minions. Unfortunately, the low statline makes it rather inefficient.

Standard Format

Stitched Tracker is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

 

Knights of the Frozen Throne

hh.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Deathrattle minion to your hand.
hh.name: Shallow Gravedigger
hh.flavor_text: It's hard to put them six feet under when you're three feet tall.
hh.guide:
Shallow Gravedigger is a Rare Neutral card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a three-mana 3/1 minion with a Deathrattle to add a random Deathrattle minion to your hand.

As an upside, a random effect can give you a card from another class, such as Tirion Fordring when not playing Paladin. Unfortunately, there are lots of Deathrattle minions in the game, and the probability to get a good one is not high.

Less than half of the Deathrattle minions see play in any viable decks: while that kind of resource pool could be reasonable enough for a Discover effect, it means that most of the time you get minions that are not good enough to see play on their own from a completely random effect such as Shallow Gravedigger.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

There is another three-mana 3/1 Deathrattle minion in the game, Eggnapper. That minion sees occasional play because it is sticky: its Deathrattle summons two 1/1 Beasts, which is also a useful tribal tag. Shallow Gravedigger is a lot different: it is a value card, but quite unreliable at that.

Shallow Gravedigger can be resummoned by N'Zoth, the Corruptor to gain even more Deathrattle minions.

Standard Format

Shallow Gravedigger is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

There are the following Deathrattle minions in Standard format:

  • Fiery Bat

  • Mistress of Mixtures
  • Possessed Villager
  • Raptor Hatchling

  • Selfless Hero

Two mana (10 minions):

  • Bloodmage Thalnos
  • Darkshire Librarian
  • Jade Swarmer
  • Kindly Grandmother
  • Loot Hoarder
  • Primalfin Champion

  • Shimmering Tempest
  • Undercity Huckster

Three mana (13 minions):

  • Backstreet Leper
  • Deadly Fork
  • Devilsaur Egg
  • Eggnapper
  • Harvest Golem
  • Igneous Elemental
  • Mountainfire Armor

  • Sergeant Sally
  • Shaky Zipgunner
  • Shallow Gravedigger
  • Spawn of N'Zoth

Four mana (15 minions):

  • Arfus
  • Arrogant Crusader

  • Infested Tauren

Five mana (7 minions):

  • Abomination

Six mana (7 minions):

  • Aya Blackpaw

Seven mana (3 minions):

  • Abominable Bowman

Eight mana (2 minions):

  • Anomalus
  • Tirion Fordring

Nine mana (2 minions):

  • Hadronox

Ten mana (1 minion):

  • Deathwing, Dragonlord

Overall, there are 72 Deathrattle minions in Standard format. Almost half of them (35) cost three mana or less, with 50 of the 72 costing four mana or less. Generally, then, Shallow Gravedigger will provide you with a relatively small minion.

Wild Format

One mana (3 minions):

Four mana (6 minions):

  • Anub'ar Ambusher
  • Dreadsteed

  • Voidcaller

Five mana (4 minions):

  • Anubisath Sentinel
  • Feugen
  • Sludge Belcher
  • Stalagg

Six mana (5 minions):

  • Piloted Sky Golem
  • Sylvanas Windrunner
  • The Skeleton Knight
  • Toshley
  • Wobbling Runts

Seven mana (2 minions):

  • Chillmaw
  • Malorne

Eight mana (2 minions):

  • Rhonin
  • Sneed's Old Shredder

Nine mana (2 minions):

  • Anub'arak
  • Majordomo Executus

Wild format thus adds another 35 Deathrattle minions for a total of 107 minions. While the overall quality of Wild-only Deathrattle minions is slightly higher than Standard format minions, the overall pool remains fairly weak and unpredictable for a fully random effect.

hh.text: Battlecry: Replace spells in your hand with random spells (from your opponent's class).
hh.name: Lilian Voss
hh.flavor_text: She doesn't feel pity, or remorse, or fear. And she absolutely will not stop... ever, until all necromancers are dead.
hh.guide:
Lilian Voss is a Legendary Rogue class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a four-mana 4/5 minion with a Battlecry to replace spells in your hand with random spells from your opponent’s class.

Lilian Voss has strong stats for its mana cost. Chillwind Yeti was once considered a great minion – and it is still not a bad card for beginners even though it has since been surpassed – and it has the same statline for the same cost without any effects.

Even though Lilian Voss is obviously a very random card, there are ways to take control of it: as it only replaces the spells in your hand – not minions, not weapons, not Hero cards – and it only gives you spells from your opponent’s class in return, you can set up your hand so that you only replace specific cards.

If you wonder how good random spells can be, the closest comparisons are Babbling Book and Cabalist's Tome. Admittedly, both give you spells in the class that has perhaps the strongest assortment of spells, but their results cannot be denied. Random spells, especially multiple random spells, can be strong.

Lilian Voss can sometimes even save Rogue from itself. Most Rogue decks are spell-heavy, and sometimes you end up with a hand full of Counterfeit Coins and Preparations but nothing to use them on. In such a scenario, Lilian Voss can potentially turn those dead cards into something useful.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

As Lilian Voss only replaces the spells in your hand, it has strong synergy with Ethereal Peddler and Obsidian Shard, both of which can safely stay in your hand when you play Lilian Voss.

Burgly Bully can create additional Coins for you, which can then be turned into spells with Lilian Voss.

Razorpetals, Counterfeit Coins, and any random spells generated, for example, by Shaku, the Collector, are ideal fodder for Lilian Voss if you do not plan to use them for card draw with Gadgetzan Auctioneer or for Combo activation.

On the other hand, replacing your cheap tempo spells with random spells has poor synergy with Gadgetzan Auctioneer, Edwin VanCleef, and various Combo effects.

As most Rogue effects that generate random cards from the opponent’s class can also generate minions, weapons, and Hero cards, Lilian Voss cannot be used to reroll all of your previously generated cards, only the ones that happen to be spells.

Standard Format

Lilian Voss is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

While some classes are more known for their minions than their spells, all classes actually have a lot of spells even in Standard format:

  • Druid: 35 spells
  • Mage: 35 spells
  • Priest: 35 spells
  • Paladin: 32 spells
  • Shaman: 29 spells
  • Hunter: 28 spells
  • Rogue: 28 spells
  • Warlock: 28 spells
  • Warrior: 28 spells

Wild Format

All classes have a lot of spells in Wild as well:

  • Mage: 46 spells
  • Priest: 45 spells
  • Druid: 43 spells
  • Paladin: 41 spells
  • Hunter: 38 spells
  • Shaman: 37 spells
  • Warlock: 37 spells
  • Rogue: 34 spells
  • Warrior: 33 spells

 

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide where we share all of the information available and put the cards in a visual guide format.

Make sure to follow us on the social media methods provided above for the fastest updates on all of the latest Frozen Throne cards.

hh.guide:
What is Lifesteal?

Lifesteal is one of the main mechanics of the Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. When a card with Lifesteal deals damage, your hero is healed for the same amount. It does not matter whether your minion is attacking or being attacked, it will heal you.

This Sounds A Lot Like Wickerflame

That's because it's the same effect. Both Mistress of Pain and Wickerflame Burnbristle will be updated with the new keyword once the expansion launches.

What Other Cards Have Lifesteal?

  • Spirit Lash

hh.text: Deathrattle: Summon your Taunt minions that died this game.
hh.name: Hadronox
hh.flavor_text: The viziers of Azjol-Nerub released Hadronox as a last-ditch effort to hold back the Lich King. They did so by VERY carefully scooping him up in a LARGE newspaper and releasing him.
hh.guide:
Hadronox is a Legendary Druid class card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a nine-mana 3/7 Beast minion with a Deathrattle that summons your Taunt minions that died during the game.

Hadronox only summons minions that have Taunt naturally. If you simply give a minion Taunt, by any means, it will not be summoned. Druid class minions can be a bit hard to read, because some of them transform into actual Taunt minions, and some of them only gain Taunt. The ones that transform are summoned back by Hadronox, while the ones that gain Taunt are not.

Because Hadronox summons the minions and does not play them, any Battlecry effects are not triggered.

Hadronox can be used to build a powerful board in the late game much in the same way as N'Zoth, the Corruptor – which, incidentally, can in turn resummon Hadronox – but because Hadronox’s ability is a Deathrattle, it can be countered by a Silence or Transformation effect or by stealing Hadronox before it dies.

Between Hadronox and N’Zoth, Druid has some very powerful value tools, but balancing the use of those value tools with means to survive long enough to use them remains a challenge.

Hadronox summons the friendly Taunt minions who died during the game in a random order. Therefore, if you do not have enough room on the board for all friendly Taunt minions that died during the game, it is random which ones you get back.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Shellshifter and Druid of the Claw can transform into Taunt minions when played. Therefore, if used in their Taunt forms, they will be resummoned by Hadronox.

Ancient of War, on the other hand, gains Taunt from its Choose One effect. Therefore, it will not be resummoned by Hadronox. The same applies to any other minions that gain Taunt from a buff or even from an effect on the card itself. For example, Nesting Roc gains Taunt from its Battlecry, so it will not be resummoned by Hadronox.

C'Thun will not be resummoned by Hadronox even if it has been given Taunt by Twilight Geomancer. However, a C’Thun Druid deck can include a number of other Taunt minions that will be summoned back by Hadronox: Dark Arakkoa, Twin Emperor Vek'lor, and Crazed Worshipper. When minions are summoned back by Hadronox, their Battlecry effects will not trigger, so Dark Arakkoa will not buff C’Thun again.

Hadronox itself has Deathrattle, so it can be resummoned by N’Zoth, the Corruptor. N’Zoth will resummon Hadronox even if the original one is silenced to prevent its Deathrattle from triggering. However, if the original Hadronox is transformed, for example by Hex or Polymorph, N’Zoth will not be able to summon it back.

Hex transforms a minion into a Frog with Taunt, so the Frog is eligible to be resummoned by Hadronox. This can be a downside if you already have enough dead Taunt minions and the Frog ends up taking the spot of a more valuable minion.

Hadronox is a Beast, so you can summon another copy of Hadronox with Menagerie Warden. You can also draw Hadronox with The Curator.

Spiritsinger Umbra can trigger Hadronox’s Deathrattle when it is played. To do this in a single turn, you would need 13 mana, so a single Innervate is not enough, you’d also need a Coin, another Innervate, or some discount effect on either of the cards.

There are also more random ways to get Hadronox on the board: Barnes can pull a 1/1 copy and Bright-Eyed Scout can draw it as a five-cost minion. Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound can also pull it from the deck.

If you’re looking for ways to kill your own Hadronox, Naturalize works, and you can even use it on the turn you play Hadronox. In Wild, Mulch is an option. You can also Wrath or Starfall your own Hadronox to deal a little more damage to it after attacking into a minion. Unfortunately, you cannot Swipe or Book Wyrm your own minion. Therefore, getting Hadronox to die on the turn it is played or even the following turn can be difficult.

Strongshell Scavenger can be used after Hadronox dies to give all the summoned Taunt minions +2/+2 – assuming that the board is not full so that there is room to play it. It can also be used earlier in the game, but the buffs do not persist, so the minions summoned by Hadronox only have their base stats.

Standard Format

Hadronox is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in Spring 2019.

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide.

hh.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 2-Cost cards, give all minions in your deck +1/+1.
hh.name: Prince Keleseth
hh.flavor_text: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to buff his brothers.
hh.guide:
Prince Keleseth is a Legendary Neutral card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a two-mana 2/2 minion with a Battlecry to give all minions in your deck +1/+1 if there are no two-cost cards in your deck.

All the Prince Legendaries in Knights of the Frozen Throne share a similar condition: no cards of certain mana cost in the deck. This includes all cards, whether minions, spells, weapons, or Heroes. The condition only checks for cards remaining in the deck, so in theory you can include some such cards in the deck – the Prince’s effect is simply unavailable until all of them have been drawn.

Prince Keleseth’s effect only buffs cards in your deck, not on the board or in your hand.

Prince Keleseth’s effect is one you want to activate as soon as possible. Therefore, you generally cannot afford to include any two-cost cards in the deck, as they would almost always delay the effect. Yet, there is also always the chance the Prince Keleseth ends up near the bottom of your deck, in which case it is almost useless in that particular game. Therefore, you cannot rely too heavily on the Prince either.

Prince Keleseth’s effect fits aggressive decks: a small buff is generally inconsequential for a control deck, and even if such a buff could benefit some combo deck, it could not rely on the Prince, as it only buffs cards that have not yet been drawn, and therefore assembling the right combo would be difficult, as the combo piece need to be drawn after the Prince has been played in order to get the buff.

Examining the lists of important two-cost cards below, it can be seen that Paladin and Warlock generally have the least to lose by including Prince Keleseth in their decks.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Prince Keleseth’s effect is similar to the Wild Shaman Legendary minion The Mistcaller. However, unlike the Mistcaller, Prince Keleseth does not buff the minions in your hand.

You can Shadowstep Prince Keleseth back to your hand for more buffs. You could also do it with Youthful Brewmaster or Gadgetzan Ferryman, but as those cards cost two mana, not drawing them first would disable Prince Keleseth’s ability.

Standard Format

Prince Keleseth is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

Some key two-mana cards in Standard format:

Druid:

  • Wrath
  • Wild Growth
  • Mark of Y'Shaarj
  • Power of the Wild
  • Druid of the Swarm

Hunter:

  • All Hunter Secrets
  • Crackling Razormaw
  • Scavenging Hyena
  • Kindly Grandmother

Mage:

  • Frostbolt
  • Primordial Glyph
  • Medivh's Valet
  • Arcanologist
  • Sorcerer's Apprentice
  • Pyros

Paladin:

  • Equality
  • Hydrologist
  • Grimestreet Outfitter
  • Argent Protector

Priest:

  • Radiant Elemental
  • Shadow Word: Pain
  • Shadow Visions
  • Divine Spirit

Rogue:

  • Eviscerate
  • Sap
  • Razorpetal Lasher
  • Jade Swarmer

hh.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 3-Cost cards, transform into a 3/3 copy of a minion.
hh.name: Prince Taldaram
hh.flavor_text: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to copy others.
hh.guide:
Prince Taldaram is a Legendary Neutral card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a three-mana 3/3 minion with a Battlecry to transform into a 3/3 copy of a minion if there are no three-cost cards in your deck.

All the Prince Legendaries in Knights of the Frozen Throne share a similar condition: no cards of certain mana cost in the deck. This includes all cards, whether minions, spells, weapons, or Heroes. The condition only checks for cards remaining in the deck, so in theory you can include some such cards in the deck – the Prince’s effect is simply unavailable until all of them have been drawn.

The effect of Prince Taldaram works like Faceless Manipulator, except that it always has 3/3 stats. You choose a minion on the board, either a friendly minion or an enemy minion, for Prince Taldaram to copy. If there are no minions on the board, Prince Taldaram is a vanilla 3/3 minion.

Prince Taldaram is a combo card first and foremost. It can serve as a copy of a powerful effect, such as Tirion Fordring or Cairne Bloodhoof, but the cost of not running any three-cost cards is a hefty price to pay for a mid-game threat.

A combo deck can potentially ignore the downside of Prince Taldaram: if you draw your entire deck anyway, you will also draw any three-cost cards from it, and therefore Prince Taldaram’s effect will be active when needed. This is good, as there are lots of good three-cost cards in the game, and building a deck without any of them would be problematic.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Combo decks can be interrupted, especially by Dirty Rat. Should Prince Taldaram be pulled from hand prematurely, the combo is rendered unusable. The popularity of Dirty Rat depends on the overall meta.

Prince Taldaram can give Exodia Mage an additional Sorcerer's Apprentice for the infinite Fireball combo: it can fill in for a Sorcerer’s Apprentice that was pulled from hand by Dirty Rat, or it can be used instead of a Sorcerer’s Apprentice or a Molten Reflection that is still in the deck – as long as there are no three-mana cards left in the deck. However, Mage can also fill the same role with Simulacrum, which is way less conditional.

Other potential combo cards for Prince Taldaram to copy include Prophet Velen and Malygos.

If Prince Taldaram that has copied a minion is silenced, it gains the original stats of the minion that it had copied.

Standard Format

Prince Taldaram is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

To give you an idea of what you will sacrifice in order to run Prince Taldaram, here are some key three-cost cards:

hh.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 4-Cost cards, gain Lifesteal and Taunt.
hh.name: Prince Valanar
hh.flavor_text: Three Princes stand before you. This one devours one after another.
hh.guide:
Prince Valanar is a Legendary Neutral card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a four-mana 4/4 minion with a Battlecry to gain Lifesteal and Taunt if there are no four-cost cards in your deck.

All the Prince Legendaries in Knights of the Frozen Throne share a similar condition: no cards of certain mana cost in the deck. This includes all cards, whether minions, spells, weapons, or Heroes. The condition only checks for cards remaining in the deck, so in theory you can include some such cards in the deck – the Prince’s effect is simply unavailable until all of them have been drawn.

A four-mana 4/4 with Taunt a Lifesteal is definitely a powerful minion, but it is worth the sacrifice? The sacrifice needed to make Prince Valanar work is generally smaller than for the other Princes: two- and three-mana slots are so crucial for the early game, whereas the cards at four mana are somewhat more negotiable. Whether it is right for you, check out the class cards and neutral cards you would have to give up in order to use the Prince.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

Bloodworm is a similar card: it costs one more mana and does not have Taunt, but it does not have any requirements either.

Standard Format

Prince Valanar is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

hh.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Death Knight card to your hand.
hh.name: Arfus
hh.flavor_text: There must always be a Lick King.
hh.guide:
Arfus is a Legendary Neutral card from Knights of the Frozen Throne expansion. It is a four-mana 2/2 Beast minion with a Deathrattle to add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

It is important to not confuse these Death Knight cards to the Death Knight Hero cards! They are not the same.

There are eight Death Knight cards available:

  • Anti-Magic Shell: A four-mana spell that gives your minions +2/+2 and the ability Can’t be targeted by spell or Hero Powers.
  • Army of the Dead: A six-mana spell that removes the top five cards of your deck and summons any minions it removes.
  • Death and Decay: A three-mana spell that deals three damage to all enemies.
  • Death Coil: A two-mana spell that deals five damage to an enemy or restores five Health to a friendly character.
  • Death Grip: A two-mana spell that steals a minion from your opponent’s deck and adds it to your hand. Yes, it actually removes the card from your opponent’s deck and does not merely copy it.
  • Doom Pact: A five-mana spell that destroys all minions and removes a card from the top of your deck for each minion destroyed.
  • Frostmourne: A seven-mana 5/3 weapon with a Deathrattle to summon all minions it killed.
  • Obliterate: A two-mana spell that destroys a minion and deals damage equal to its Health to your Hero.

The Death Knight cards are powerful, but there is a level of unpredictability to them. If you have ever had your fingers crossed hoping for just the right random card from Ysera, out of five possibilities, trying to find just the right Death Knight card from eight possibilities can be quite difficult.

Attempting to categorize the cards, there is a wide variety of effects available:

  • Buff (Anti-Magic Shell)
  • Summon (Army of the Dead)
  • Area-of-effect damage / board clear (Death and Decay, Doom Pact)
  • Direct damage (Death and Decay, Death Coil)
  • Healing (Death Coil)
  • Single-target removal (Death Coil, Obliterate, Death and Decay, Doom Pact if you don’t care about your own board)
  • Resource generation (Death Grip)
  • Weapon (Frostmourne)

Overall, Death Knight cards can do it all. If you can find the right ones. Gaining multiple Death Knight cards is a powerful win condition, whereas a single Death Knight card will have your opponent guessing as it can literally be almost any type of effect in the game.

Arfus is severely under-statted as a mere 2/2 and playing it is a significant tempo loss. Its main use is to provide the Death Knight card and you are really paying in advance for the power that card holds.

Significant Interactions and Related Cards

The only cards that give access to Death Knight cards are The Lich King, Arfus, and Hunter Death Knight Zombeasts that include Arfus.

Spiritsinger Umbra can trigger the effect of Arfus immediately upon play, giving you an additional Death Knight card.

N'Zoth, the Corruptor can resummon Arfus for more Death Knight cards.

There are various ways to trigger or copy the Deathrattles of friendly minions, which can be used to get more cards from Arfus:

  • Baron Rivendare (Neutral, Wild)
  • Corpse Raiser (Neutral)
  • Moat Lurker (Neutral)
  • Feign Death (Hunter, Wild)
  • Terrorscale Stalker (Hunter)
  • Play Dead (Hunter)
  • Princess Huhuran (Hunter)
  • Desperate Stand (Paladin)
  • Unearthed Raptor (Rogue, Wild)
  • Ancestral Spirit (Shaman)

Standard Format

Arfus is part of Hearthstone Standard format. It will rotate out of Standard in spring 2019.

 

Knights of the Frozen Throne

Want to learn more about Hearthstone's upcoming Knights of the Frozen Throne? Head on over to our expansion guide.

Make sure to follow us on the social media methods provided above for the fastest updates on all of the latest Frozen Throne cards.
